title: eth/tracers: callTracer output traces append with events
body:
# Rationale

Why should this feature exist?

Currently, the `callTracer` only captures the `call, create` traces. And in some cases, we want to capture what is triggered by each trace, eg: call `USDT.tranfer` will trigger out `Transfer(from,  to, value)` event.

What are the use-cases?

As EventLog is often used to record an event that occurred, we can combine the call trace(input) + event(output) to analysis some complex transactions.  eg:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3627395/195141185-d56d17fc-8d5f-41ed-bba9-fb9721f84b27.png)

From https://tx.eth.samczsun.com/ethereum/0x4b119a4f4ba1ad483e9851973719f310527b43f3fcc827b6d52db9f4c1ddb6a2

# Implementation

Do you have ideas regarding the implementation of this feature?

I want to add a new option named `includingLog bool` in callTracerConfig https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/1c737e8b6da2b14111f8224ef3f385b1fe0cd8b9/eth/tracers/native/call.go#L76-L78

Request as below:

```json
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "method": "debug_traceTransaction",
    "params": [
        "0xfoobar",
        {
            "tracer": "callTracer",
            "timeout": "120s", 
            "tracerConfig": {"includingLog": true}
        }
    ],
    "id": 67
}
```

And the output looks like this:

Are you willing to implement this feature?

Yes, üôãüèº

Sounds reasonable. I am not sure if it's better to add functionality into existing tracers, with custom configurations, or simply adding new tracers. 
But I guess maybe if you implement it, we can see which feels nicest.
I'll try to implement it ASAP
